title: PSA: You bought a pre-leveled account.
body:
You played for years after that. You were legit. You forgot you had bought the account.

Then came the ban for using third party software. 

"Huh?!?"

That's right because the person you bought that account from used bots and scripts to level it up. gg.


...and this is why we don't buy pre-leveled accounts.

The first MOBA iteration was an old Starcraft map titled "Aeons of Strife." So the MOBA genre has, in some form, been around since about 1998. DotA later came along as a Warcraft 3 map and really popularized the gameplay type by adding more features and using Warcraft 3's engine to add more complex RPG elements to the genre as opposed to AoS's resource gain upon killing enemy heroes/units to upgrade your own hero's damage, armor, etc. 

So, yeah. MOBAs have been around in some form for almost 18 years now.

I'm going to play the Devil's advocate here.

Riot doesn't allow this because new players would probably fall for it. "What, why should I spend months leveling an account and grinding IP when I can just buy one?" League has an _incredible_ learning curve, and sometimes people who have played for years have forgotten this fact. There is a good reason getting to level 30 takes a long-ass time.

There's also the suggestion that Riot doesn't like smurfs on a philosophical level. They want you, the player, to grow attached to your account. They want you to see it as your own investment of time into the game; you've earned that IP, you've bought the champs you like, you've climbed the rank with that, you have friends who identify you by that account, etc. They want you to take that account as high as you can in the ranks. This would all lose meaning if we could easily just fork over some money for a brand-new account.
TBH I don't buy accounts, but even I know having riot make a service to buy a level 30 account would make them a lot of money.
